item.title: Taylor add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Taylor add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "If you hear a voice within you say <i>you cannot paint,</i> then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Taylor add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "The fishermen know that the sea is dangerous and the storm terrible, but they have never found these dangers sufficient reason for remaining ashore." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Taylor add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "One may have a blazing hearth in one's soul and yet no one ever came to sit by it. Passers-by see only a wisp of smoke from the chimney and continue on their way." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Taylor add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "In the moment when I truly understand my enemy, understand him well enough to defeat him, then in that very moment I also love him. I think it’s impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves. And then, in that very moment when I love them.... I destroy them." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Taylor add a quote by Ken Wilber
item.description: "The simple fact is that we live in a world of conflict and opposites because we live in a world of boundaries. Since every boundary line is also a battle line, here is the human predicament: the firmer one’s boundaries, the more entrenched are one’s battles. The more I hold onto pleasure, the more I necessarily fear pain. The more I pursue goodness, the more I am obsessed with evil. The more I seek success, the more I must dread failure. The harder I cling to life, the more terrifying death becomes. The more I value anything, the more obsessed I become with its loss. Most of our problems, in other words, are problems of boundaries and the opposites they create." -- Ken Wilber

item.title: Taylor add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Belief isn't simply a thing for fair times and bright days...What is belief - what is faith - if you don't continue in it after failure?...Anyone can believe in someone, or something that always succeeds...But failure...ah, now, that is hard to believe in, certainly and truly. Difficult enough to have value. Sometimes we just have to wait long enough...then we find out why exactly it was that we kept believing...There's always another secret." -- Brandon Sanderson
